title: Cadillac Secretly Made The Escalade-V Quieter For 2025, But It'll Still Wake The Neighbors
description: When General Motors decided to shove a 6.2-liter supercharged V8 into its three-row SUV to create the Escalade-V back in 2023, the resulting creation was so loud that anybody who bought one seemed likely to receive noise complaints from their neighbors... in the adjacent county. But for 2025, the ...

descriptionSummary: The behemoth Escalade-V has a newfound reputation for civility. Gone are the ear-shattering days of its thunderous V8 engine, now muffled in favor of a more subdued roar.

title: LEAKED: Toyota Prepares to Launch Electric Pickup
description: Toyota’s most popular pickup is finally going electric, or at least that’s what a leaked internal presentation slide seems to confirm. Shared with regional media during a private briefing in Asia and then on Instagram, the image clearly shows the silhouette of a Hilux BEV alongside Toyota’s ...
titleSummary: "Shock in the Garage: Toyota's Secret EV Pickup Finally Hits the Road"
descriptionSummary: A leaked document has reportedly revealed plans for an electrified version of Toyota's best-selling pickup truck, which is set to debut in the region following a private briefing with Asian media.

title: Elon Musk Promises ‘Crazy’ Tesla Roadster Tech — Could It Really Fly?
description: Elon Musk is once again talking about flying cars, and this time, he insists it’s not science fiction. During a recent podcast appearance, the Tesla CEO hinted that the long-delayed Tesla Roadster will feature what he called “crazy technology,” suggesting the upcoming model could ...
titleSummary: "Musk Teases Revolutionary New Tesla Design, But Can it Take to the Skies?"
descriptionSummary: Tesla's Elon Musk is reviving his vision for airborne transportation, assuring it's not pure fantasy. In a recent podcast chat, he teased that the next-generation Tesla Roadster will boast cutting-edge tech that could transform the driving experience.

title: Scout Buyers Love EVs — But 80% Still Chose the One With a Gas Engine
description: Volkswagen’s revival of the Scout brand has received a mostly warm reception, even though the upcoming Terra pickup and Traveler SUV will stick with electric power—as opposed to the large Sixes and V8s of the old-school Scouts. Production of the new Scouts is expected to begin in 2027, but ...
titleSummary: "Electric Vehicles Spark Interest, but Traditional Fueled Cars Remain Top Choice Among Car Shoppers"
descriptionSummary: Volkswagen's rebirth of the iconic Scout brand has generated excitement among fans, who are eager to see the revival take shape despite a departure from the traditional gas-guzzling engines that defined its predecessors. Production is slated for 2027.

title: Mazda’s First Born-EV Is Coming in 2027 — and It Promises Classic Mazda Feel
description: Mazda isn’t necessarily a major player in the born-EV space. While the MX-30 is a lovely little electric crossover, its underpinnings are mostly derived from the gas-powered CX-30. You could say the same for the Mazda EZ-6 and the EZ-60, as both cars feature platforms made by Changan—Mazda’s ...
titleSummary: "Mazda's Revival: Electrified Elegance Returns with the Brand's First Pure-Bred EV"
descriptionSummary: Mazda's electric vehicle offerings currently trail behind those of its competitors, with models like the MX-30 leveraging existing gas-powered platform designs, such as that used in the CX-30.

title: Ford Has A Plan To Thwart A Lagging EV Market
description: Despite a disappointing earnings call, Ford stock was up ten percent on Friday morning. Investors are pouring money into the automaker, which saw over $1 billion in losses on EVs, prompting the company to reduce its 2025 EBIT forecast by $1 billion, too. Ford also faces issues with its relationship ...
titleSummary: Ford Unveils Ambitious Strategy to Revitalize Failing Electric Vehicle Sales
descriptionSummary: Ford's shares surged ten percent on a volatile Friday morning, despite a lackluster earnings report that revealed significant investments and major setbacks, including a nearly billion-dollar EV loss and a revised 2025 profit forecast.

title: Meet the Ioniq 9 BigTime — Hyundai’s Boldest EV Yet Hits the Dirt
description: SEMA is quite the place for automakers to show off their wild projects. Hyundai is planning something big for SEMA—quite ...
titleSummary: "Hyundai's Electric Dream Machine Roars to Life in the Ioniq 9 BigTime"
descriptionSummary: At SEMA, automakers showcase their boldest creations. Nissan's Dune Patrol takes center stage, built on an Armada platform as an adventurous support vehicle. Meanwhile, Toyota's ruggedized Corolla Cross, the Nasu Edition, gets ready to tackle tough terrain alongside Hyundai's upcoming SEMA surprise.

title: America’s Most Stolen Cars – Is Yours at Risk?
description: The good news is that the pandemic-fuelled peak in car thefts is well on its way to pre-pandemic levels. Data from the National Insurance Crime Bureau (NICB) shows a 23% decrease in vehicle thefts in the United States for the first half of 2025. NICB reports that this could make it the second year ...
titleSummary: "Stealing America's Wheels: Top Targets and How to Protect Your Ride"
descriptionSummary: Vehicle theft rates are steadily returning to normal after surging during the pandemic, according to recent data from the National Insurance Crime Bureau. The US saw a significant 23% drop in auto thefts for the first half of 2025, a promising trend that may signal a full recovery by year's end.

title: Hyundai And Kia’s EV Sales Collapsed In October—Expect More Pain Ahead
description: Well, we knew it was coming. High EV sales in the third quarter were largely the result of consumers trying to take advantage of the federal tax credit, which fell away at the end of September in the United States. Industry analysts warned that a sharp decline in EV sales would follow, and based on ...
titleSummary: "Hyundai and Kia's Electric Vehicle Sales Plummet in October, Setting a Troubling Precedent"
descriptionSummary: As expected, third-quarter electric vehicle (EV) sales surged before the expiration of the US federal tax incentive, now gone by October 1st. Analysts predicted a significant drop-off to follow, and the numbers seem to be confirming that prediction.

title: Honda Refuses to Share S2000 Revival With Another Brand
description: Last sold in America for the 2009 model year, the Honda S2000 was a thoroughly engaging roadster with a rev-happy four-cylinder engine and entertaining rear-wheel-drive handling dynamics. There has been no successor to the S2000, which is why values of used examples are high today. But could the ...
titleSummary: Honda Keeps Exclusive Ownership of Fabled S2000 Roadster's Future Plans
descriptionSummary: The Honda S2000, discontinued in the US after 2009, was a fan-favorite roadster with a spirited inline-four engine and razor-sharp handling. Its absence has fueled interest in remaining examples, driving up prices among enthusiasts.

title: The HEMI-Powered Dodge Charger Lives—But There's a Catch
description: When the Dodge Charger was revived 20(!) years ago, one can say that there was some initial backlash on the basis that it had two more doors than the original. descriptionSummary: When the Dodge Charger returned to the market 20 years ago, some fans were skeptical about its new four-door design. However, this criticism dissipated as high-performance variants revitalized the model and solidified its place in American muscle car history.

descriptionSummary: Every year, SEMA shines a spotlight on innovation in automotive design, engineering, and performance. descriptionSummary: Toyota, a pioneer in hydrogen-powered vehicles, is redirecting its focus towards electric cars, driven by growing demand and improved infrastructure. To infuse its EVs with a competitive edge, the brand has partnered with motorsports experts to accelerate innovation.

description: Autoblog has interviewed the President and CEO of Valvoline Global Operations, Jamal Muashsher, about the automotive industry’s projected shortage of 4.3 million skilled workers worldwide by 2030, and the predicted 820,000 mechanic shortage in the U.S. by 2028. title: The $63,000 Volkswagen Golf GTI Is the Most Expensive Ever Made

title: This Tiny Mitsubishi Van Has More Adventure Spirit Than Most SUVs

descriptionSummary: In the US, Kei cars fly under the radar due to restrictive laws, but if regulations changed overnight, I'd covet a Mitsubishi Delica Mini – an endearing and practical vehicle with charming proportions.

description: General Motors is betting that by 2028, you won’t need to look at the road. descriptionSummary: General Motors is poised to revolutionize transportation with autonomous technology by 2028. title: Buyer's Remorse: These 10 Luxury Cars Are Most Likely To Be Returned Within A Year

title: Toyota’s Tiny New Roadster Is Smaller Than a Miata—but Looks Just as Fun

descriptionSummary: The Daihatsu Copen has long captured our attention with its quirky charm and open-top personality. After a lengthy hiatus, it's finally getting a much-needed refresh – and we couldn't be more eager to see what Toyota has in store for this pint-sized convertible.

title: Toyota Sued for $5.7 Billion Over Mirai Hydrogen Cars
description: Three owners of Toyota’s Mirai hydrogen-fuel-cell vehicle have filed a class-action lawsuit against the Japanese manufacturer on behalf of all California-based Mirai buyers and lessees from 2016 to 2025. The complaint demands at least $5.7 billion in damages, marking one of the biggest legal ...

descriptionSummary: A group of California-based Toyota Mirai owners are suing the company for allegedly deceiving them about the fuel efficiency of their hydrogen-fuel-cell vehicles, seeking up to $5.7 billion in damages.

title: Toyota Wants to Help GM and Ford Sell Cars in Japan
description: In a bid to resolve its ongoing trade dispute with the United States, Japan signaled it plans to invest as much as $500 billion in the U.S., including key economic sectors such as artificial intelligence, energy, manufacturing and critical minerals. As much as $10 billion of that figure will come ...
titleSummary: "Automakers Join Forces: Toyota Opens Doors for American Brands in Japanese Market"
descriptionSummary: To ease tensions in its long-standing trade standoff with the US, Japan is poised to inject a substantial investment into American markets, focusing on high-growth areas like AI, energy, production, and strategic resources. Upwards of $10 billion is earmarked for these initiatives.

title: Mazda Says the EV Rush Ignores the Real Emissions Problem
description: Mazda is one of the last automakers to embrace electric vehicles, and for good reason. EVs might dominate headlines and government agendas, but Mazda believes the sustainability conversation has been one-sided. As the company introduces its redesigned logo, it’s also reasserting a core part of its ...

descriptionSummary: Mazda is taking a measured approach to electrification, resisting the industry's fervor for electric vehicles in favor of a more nuanced exploration of sustainable mobility. A fresh logo marks the start of this thoughtful new direction.

title: Elon Musk Wants Parked Teslas to Power a Global AI Network
description: Elon Musk is nothing if not a visionary, and his latest idea certainly feels like a return to form. descriptionSummary: Elon Musk is once again pushing boundaries with a groundbreaking concept. During Tesla's recent earnings call, he proposed leveraging millions of Tesla vehicles worldwide as nodes for a global, decentralized cloud computing platform.

descriptionSummary: Volkswagen is tempting Honda enthusiasts with attractive lease offers on its 2025 Tiguan, a compact SUV that's vying for loyalty from CR-V and HR-V owners by delivering substantial savings and value.

descriptionSummary: Tesla's autonomous vehicle pilot program has come under intense examination following a string of low-impact collisions in Austin, Texas, involving its self-driving taxis, even when accompanied by human observers to ensure safety protocols are being followed.

title: Toyota Gives Its Ford Transit Rival a Futuristic Makeover

title: Feds Investigate Honda Odyssey and Pilot Over Airbag and Seatbelt Concerns
description: A few days ago, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) launched two separate investigations into Honda’s two very popular family haulers. The cars in question are the Odyssey minivan (MY 2018-2022) and the three-row Pilot SUV (MY 2023-2024). Out of the roughly 583,000 vehicles ...

descriptionSummary: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration has initiated dual investigations into Honda's best-selling family-friendly models: the 2018-2022 Odyssey minivan and the 2023-2024 Pilot SUV. Approximately 583,000 vehicles are under scrutiny due to potential safety concerns.

title: Cybertruck Recall Chaos: Tesla’s ‘Indestructible’ Pickup Undone by Glue

title: 2026 Kia Niro HEV Pricing Announced — Starts at $27,090
description: Kia America has announced full pricing for the 2026 Niro HEV, confirming that its versatile hybrid crossover will start at $27,090 before destination fees. The Niro HEV continues to anchor Kia’s electrified lineup, offering standout fuel efficiency, new safety tech, and accessible ...
